issues.description: The template defines PersonService.save(Person) as a private method, but the tests and the solution expect to call personService.save(...) from outside the class. In the template tests (PersonServiceTest) personService.save(person) is invoked, which will not compile against the template's private save method. The solution repository makes save(...) public, indicating the intended visibility. This mismatch will block students: unit tests will fail to compile/run and students will be confused whether to call the repository directly or use PersonService.save().
issues.suggested_fix: Make the save(Person) method in the template's PersonService public (change 'private Person save(...)' to 'public Person save(...)') so tests and external callers can use it. Also, clarify the problem statement to consistently refer to using PersonService.save(...) (or explicitly state if repository.save(...) should be called) to avoid ambiguity.
